Reviews.Title: “Working hard and doing it right!”
Reviews.Author: IanRoberge
Reviews.Content: I stayed three weeks in early April and was extremely pleased. The apartment had everything I needed including washing machine, dishwasher, full kitchen (except stove) and microwave, etc. Daily cleaning was nice, as was free coffee and bottled water. The apartment was quite large. The location is not perfect, though it is fairly practical. It is 7-8 minutes from Termini on the back street, and right beside Castro Pretorio (two subway stops from the Coliseum). The apartment are a good five minutes walk from the main hotel. If you have free breakfast included in the morning, you do need to get to the main building. The location is safe and the steet well-lit at night, and the apartment was very quiet. I was always well-served by the front desk in the main building; they, for instance, printed tickets for visits. In fact, they seemed genuinely willing to help and wanted to please. To be picky, the television had satellite with almost all stations in Italian, but it did not have CNN International or BBC World News. Next time in Rome, I will go back in an instant. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Hound72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the midpoint of a 6 week holiday and are glad we did. The apartments were very clean and spacious...and they had a washing machine which was very handy and timely as we were able to wash all our laundry. The apartments were fully self contained but with so many great restaurants in Rome we didn't use the cooking facilities. The apartments are also conveniently located near a metro stop. You do have to walk to the Crosti Hotel about 2-3 minutes away for your included breakfast but we enjoyed the walk and the breakfast was good. Great value, great staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem.”
Reviews.Author: Shamichael
Reviews.Content: Crosti Apartments, which i thought was Crosti Hotel at the time of booking did not disappoint one bit. Roughly a few mins from the actual Crosti Hotel, the apartment is quite generous in size, consisting of a lounge room, functional kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and a fantastic rooftop terrace. Another lil gem is the addition of a Nespresso Coffee machine. All kitchen cookware are there along with a washing machine. Overall, we had a very pleasent stay with friendly staff who helped us alone the way during our first visit to Rome. Pros: - Very friendly and helpful staff - Nice buffet breakfast to start the day (Variety is the same everyday however) - Large rooms with nice little extras such as coffee machine, washing machine, etc - Great place to stay if you are expecting visitors as there is an additional sofa bed in the lounge room - Wi-Fi Internet available (Was complimentary during our trip) - Large fridge and electronic safe in the apartment. Cons: - 10-15min walk from Termini Station, although close to the next station up on the Rome Metro - Hot water system was a bit off the mark. Hot water on the shower ran out quite quickly and it was hard to regulate to the right temperature - Walls are slightly thin. Could hear the young kids from next door. Overall: Still a fantastic experience. Not perfect but the friendly and helpful staff and the extra amenities such as the washing machine and coffee machine made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: cathhhhhh
Reviews.Content: These appartments are near the termini station , and only 2 min from subway stop, so very handy.We spent 2 nights here, but they would be ideal for a longer stay, as they had a full kitchen etc. Very large older style, with tiny lift to take you up the 6 floors. Sofa bed was promised but not provided until after a long argument...with apology and 10% discount from management the next day. Great breakfast( though it was at hotel 2 blocks away). Very good 3 star accomadation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull apartment - great, low budget stay”
Reviews.Author: lianaharala
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Crosti hotel aprt. wing during Christmas holidays.Everything that other guests have mentionned it is all true.Wonderfull,big 2 bedroom apartment with a large balcony(n.14).It was fully equipped with all the stuff that a kitchen and a bathroom needs.You can easily prepare some pasta and have a glass of wine if you are in a low budget holiday.There is a small supermarket nearby and a Conad -big- supermarket in Piazza Indipendenzza.Breakfast was offered in the main building and it was very adequate(omelette,cereals,cakes,cheese,ham,yogurt ect).The apartment was cleaned every day by a very polite cleaning lady(new towels every day but not changed linen in 3 nights) You can easily go everywhere downtown if you take bus 85 from Piazza Indipendenza which is easier from the metro.You can find your itineraries in ATAC site.Try the canolies in the cafe Giuliani I think in via Solferino and great ice cream near Pantheon in gelateria Della Palma (via della Madalena)

Reviews.Title: “Do not book at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terry763
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite superior apartment. I rercevied a junior apartment. At the end of my week stay I was charged for the larger apartment. It was a bait and switch.. Also the apartments are not next door to hotel crosti but some distance away. Stay away from this bait and swith. Terry S

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: vertdure
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the apartment wing of Hotel Crosti. The apartments are in a quiet group about 5 minutes walk from the actual hotel and the accomodating staff will help you with your luggage from there.The tiny elevator is a bit of a shock at first but it worked perfectly. I cannot speak highly enough of the apartment itself. It was very large and had everything we required including a lovely balcony with a clothes washing machine a nice touch with all the soap and amenities in the kitchen and bathroom.The breakfast in the hotel was a wonderful treat we expected continental this was a full meal complete enough to be a lunch and the service was pleasant. There is a supermarket a couple of minutes away and the subway and bus connection to the centre of Rome was close by. Termini Railway station was about 7 minutes easy walk. Make sure you ask for the apartment with the balcony. I couldn't wish for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartments”
Reviews.Author: Kate1004
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Crosti Apartments for 6 nights at the end of October 2011. When we arrived in Rome airport- we followed the signs for the airport shuttle bus (TerraVision) to the Termini main station. It cost 6 euros for a single. 40 minute journey into Rome. The bus drops on Via Marsala (which is the East side of the termini) Walk north, up the road, turn right on to the main road, and follow it down past the Conad Supermarket, then turn left on to Via Castelfidardo and the hotel is on the right, about 8 mins walk. Once at the hotel we were greeted very warmly, and our bags were carried to the apartments. There is another small supermarket on the way, and it is literally 5 mins walk away from the hotel. The apartments do have a crazy 70's lift- which is completely safe, tiny and fun. We were lucky, everyone closed the doors while we were there so we never had a problem. We had an apartment without a balcony (which was fine as it was October, although it was 22c!) If you want a balcony, it would be worth calling ahead and requesting one. Our apartment was compact but not small with dishwasher (tablets were left by cleaning lady for us) fridge, cooker, microwave, fridge and freezer, washing machine (no powder), iron and ironing board. safe (not big enough for lap top) Storage was great. No English channels on TV- but that’s half the fun. There is washing up liquid, clothes and tea towels also. Coffee machine- with free fresh coffee every day and free bottled water. Beds were comfortable, had air con. As two girls travelling together we felt very safe- there is a telephone and you can ring the hotel is you need anything. The area is very safe. We went to the Italian restaurant next door- it was ok, not amazing but suited us well for one night as we didn't want to go far. There are some lovely cafe for breakfast and take away pizza slices around the corner. The metro is 3 mins away. You can walk everywhere in Rome, but We wanted to save our feet so used the metro to the Vatican, and to the Colssium station. Buy a 75min single ticket when you go there for 1 euro. This will get you to where you want to go. Buy the all-day travel card for 4 euros, if you’re doing more than 2 journeys. Rome is very expensive! So having an apartment was fantastic as we could cook. Buying Wine and beer etc. is cheaper in the supermarket, and you can cook on the cooking hob or microwave. We made fab pasta dishes, bread, cheese, meats; take away pizza with salad and bottle of wine! Fraction of the cost from the restaurants. This made our entire holiday much cheaper than normal city breaks.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideVera
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in the apartment wing of Hotel Crosti. The apartments are in a quiet group about 5 minutes walk from the actual hotel and the accomodating staff will help you with your luggage from there. I cannot speak highly enough of the apartment itself. It was very large and had everything we required including a lovely balcony where we ate our breakfast every morning. There is a supermarket a couple of minutes away and the subway and bus connection to the centre of Rome was close by. Termini Railway station was about 7 minutes easy walk. Make sure you ask for the apartment with the balcony. I couldn't wish for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “People were friendly - Nice to have the space!”
Reviews.Author: eshober
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August with a friend. Our plane was delayed and we did not arrive til 2:30am - the guy at the desk was so kind to check us in and help us to the apartment. the apartment was very clean and provided housekeeping service every day with clean towels. Just across street from Best Western and 1 easy block to blue line metro but a bit of a 6 block schlep to the red line at Termini (you can take blue line to termini and change which we did). - Buy the 3 day train pass! The neighborhood is primarily 3 star hotels. The apartment was very clean - no mold!!!!!. The deck was great and the washer worked beautifully. A few scuffs on wall and basic furniture but just fine. Nice to have more space than a hotel room. Ask for an extra pillow - mine was a bit thin. 3 euros only for wifi for our entire stay. They provided tea and expresso for our apartment (there is an expresso maker) Breakfast did the job - I stuck to yogurt, fruit and pastry. There were eggs, toast cereal as well. It is a 4 block walk from apartment. There is an internet cafe at the corner if you need to print anything and another cafe around corner. A small market across the street next to internet cafe. Would recommend if you are looking for something simple, efficient with very nice service for an apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre apt!”
Reviews.Author: helen b
Reviews.Content: Apt very spacious with a huge outside terrace for relaxing on. Clean and tidy only slight problem would be the lift. Always needed to be shut properly for it to work and often wasn't closed. Maybe big sign on each floor might help!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: vickmeist
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews so expected the wee walk from the main hotel and small lift.... completely worth it once we got there. very private, the balcony was the best - after walking round Rome all day we could drink wine and read in the sun, brilliant. quiet and close to a lot of great little restaurants and a small convenience store. would come here again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Check out your appartment number first.”
Reviews.Author: Derrick M
Reviews.Content: When booking, check out your appartment number and ask about facilities. We booked two appartments for a week and were given numbers 12 and 18 on floor six. Neither had a balcony or terrace, but were both spacious. Appartment 12 did have a strong, stale smell in the kitchen area, talking to the porter it was obvious that this was an ongoing problem which appeared unlikely to be resolved. Kitchen utensils, cutlery and crockery were insufficient between the two apartments, we ended up have to share between the two.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Centre Appartment”
Reviews.Author: Howster79
Reviews.Content: Appartment was about 4 streets away from Hotel reception and a helpfull bell boy insisted on carrying our bags for us on arrival. Clean and spacious with everything you need for a city break. Kitchen was reasonably well equipped, however there was no oven. Large fridge and a dishwasher. Roof terrace was good to have. bedroom Air Coindition was not as efficient as it should have been, however the other units in the hallway and living area helped to kleep the bedroom cool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the money”
Reviews.Author: anitawalker
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the apartments of the hotel two blocks away which were great. Fully equipped, comfortable and very clean. Great quiet air-con and the staff were fantastic, especially the porter. The breakfast was amazing from eggs to pastries, we have never seen such a choice. They looked after our bags, nothing was too much trouble. Great position to as it was five minute walk to the termini train station, metro and bus depot. We would definitely use this hotel again if we go and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the apartments are NOT in the hotel building”
Reviews.Author: Macmedia1166
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. On checking in I was told that my apartment was not in the same building and was some 500 meters away. When I asked why the angry man at the desk told me that it was because I had booked via Agoda and they didn't like that and preferred bookings via their own Website. Once I checked into my apartment it smelt very bad, and was only a 2 star at the best. I desided to front the angry man at the from desk about the room and the way he was acting, however this time the manger was there and the mans whole attitude had changed, he was now Mr nice guy, but was told the same thing by both men, apartments booked via third party sites are in the crappy old building down the road. The apartment itself was quite big and had everything you would expect in an apartment, the only real issue was the smell and that fact it was a long way from the actually hotel, which I had to walk to each morning for my included breakfast. Each morning the man would either be angry or nice depending on who was around. Overall unless you know you are staying in the actually hotel I would avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlomangino
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful front desk staff. Went out of their way with directions, etc. Close to the Metro. No complaints -- we enjoyed our stay. 3 couples stayed at the hotel and I stayed at the apts -- very short walk from the hotel. Which was excellent -- Cludia wa verys helpful. really good place to eat by the apt -- The Archi.

Reviews.Title: “Much more room than a standard hotel suite”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We were here during Easter week so the rate was probably higher than average. The apartment was roomy with a small living room, full kitchen, bedroom, and bathroom. Our apartment was on the 7th (top) floor of an old building and had a large balcony. There wasn't much of a view, but it was pleasant to sit out there. Although the building was old, the apartment had been updated and wasn't luxurious but clean. The bed was very firm and uncomfortable to me. There is a tiny elevator where you have to manually open and close two sets of doors. If someone didn't completely close the doors when leaving the elevator it wouldn't work. A couple times I had to climb the stairs all the way to the top because the doors were left open. We had to check-in at the Crosti Hotel, which was about 4 blocks from the apartments. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. We had the option of having breakfast included in our rate and took advantage of that. Breakfast was at the hotel and was very good with a variety of pastries, cereals, yogurt, juices, etc. The apartments are only a block and a half from a metro stop and 4 blocks from Termini. If you bring a computer, there is wi-fi available in the apartments at a very reasonable price. We enjoyed our stay there and hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel location not as good as advertised, Apartment 20 very spacious”
Reviews.Author: miamiredhawk
Reviews.Content: The elevator was either not present or not operational (we looked up the shaft and did not see an elevator, when never came when pressing the button). Fortunately we didn't have to go too far with our luggage. Internet was fast and cheap at 3 Euro per day, using an ethernet cord. The rooms are small, but for the second part of our trip, we stayed at one of the Crosti's apartments when no other rooms were available. Apartment 20 was 2-3 blocks from the hotel. This is a pain when showing up at the hotel via taxi with your luggage, although a concierge carried it over with us. Apartment 20 was just 4 Euro per night more than a hotel room, but was maybe 5 times bigger than the hotel room. The apartment has all appliances and free internet. It is a bit far from all of the city's attractions, but within walking distance of the Termini Station. Restaurants around the apartment didn't look that good and the pizzeria recommended near the hotel (green awning) was not good. Breakfast at the hotel was the standard continental breakfast. Serivce was alternately great or poor depending on who was working the Crosti front counter. Taxi's to Fiumcino airport were 40 Euro when booked through the hotel, but seemed to be 55 Euro from the airport (we took a shuttle at 20 Euro per person from the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, private apartment - Roomy for three”
Reviews.Author: 40718Sue
Reviews.Content: The apartment, though located a distance from the Crosti Hotel itself, was fabulous for the three of us. The bedroom was huge, and storage for all of our things was ample. It was also pristine in regards to cleanliness. A wonderful heated towel rack is in the bathroom, the terrace we had to ourselves was a lovely plus. We sat out and drank wine on the terrace and really felt relaxed. it is a bit of a walk to breakfast which was included in a special Internet rate for the apartment. The staff was so helpful. They arranged our transportation back to the airport, and were prompt in their pick up. We loved the decor, the beautiful tiles on the floor, and in the bathroom. The beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent, and the service staff was very attentive. Everything we saw including the breakfast room bathrooms, halls and all of the open spaces were elegant. The location was outstanding right next to a subway stop, so we found getting around quite easy. Everything about our stay was perfect. We would definitely go back to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant big apartment”
Reviews.Author: talieandmike
Reviews.Content: Great apartment 5 minutes from Termini. These apartments are on the 5th 6th and 7th floors of a building in the centre of Rome. Ideal location for getting around Rome. 2 mins from metro line B Castro Pretorio station. The metro is cheap and easy to use once you know how. Tickets are £1 per 75 minutes or £4 for a full days travel on metro/trains/bus. We went to Ostia on the train. (great day out) The apartments are pretty big. Bedroom with king size comfortable bed, double wardrobe, free safe, drawers, tv with italian channels but has mtv. Kitchen with everything you need to make breakfast and simple meals. Toaster, kettle, coffee pod machine with free pods replenished daily, washing machine with powder, w.u liquid, sponges, fridge with water bottles replenished daily. Big bathroom with soap,shampoo, shower gel replenished daily. Dining table 4 chairs, bed settee for 2. Ironing board and iron. We had a lovely terrace that had a table for 4. These apartments would suit a couple/group/family. They are really clean and spacious. Excellent made service every day. The only but is the tiny lift, it works very well and is plenty big enough for 2 people and cases.

Reviews.Title: “area was very quiet .”
Reviews.Author: ksacokas
Reviews.Content: area was very quiet, and whilst the lift is small (and broke down once!), we felt safe and secure. There was an internet cafe on the corner and the local supermarkets provided everything we could want in terms of food and drink. It was an added bonus to be able to wash clothes before we moved on to our next destination. All in all we couldn't have asked for a better place to stay for such a cheap price .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartments for a very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: alwatson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crosti Apartments in December 2010 and would definitely recommend it to other travellers looking to visit Rome. We checked in at the Crosti Hotel who gave us some maps and guides, and also showed us the best Metro stops for the major tourist sites in the city. We were then taken by a member of staff to the apartments which was maybe 5 minutes away. She showed us how to use the lift which, as commented on by other reviewers, is tiny. We found the lift fine (and quite endearing) but it's worth noting that if somebody goes up in it and doesn't close the door then it won't come down so you would need to take the stairs. I think this happened once while we were there but if you can't go up stairs if necessary then this could be a problem. The apartment was very nice. It was made up of a kitchen/living area with sofa (which can be converted into a small bed), table and chairs and kitchen area with hob, large fridge, microwave, kettle, toaster etc and also had a door which opens onto the terrace. Not all apartments have a terrace, but 616 and 720 certainly do. 720 is on the top floor and has a huge terrace with views out to the mountains. The bedroom was a decent size with wardrobe, safe TV and another door to the terrace. There was also 1 pair of slippers (the disposable kind). The bathroom was spacious and very clean. In the bathroom there were towels of various sizes and a hair dryer. The apartment was cleaned every day and complementary bottles of water were left in the fridge which was a very nice touch. Breakfast can be had at the Crosti hotel for 5 Euros (as we booked room only) which was very nice indeed. It includes cereals, dried and fresh fruits, bread, pastries, cakes, fruit juices and hot drinks. The location of the apartments turned out to be fantastic during our short stay. The nearest Metro station is on the blue line (Castro Pretorio, I believe) can take you to the Termini station or you can follow it all the way to the Colosseum. It is just round the corner from the apartments. You can easily walk to the Termini in maybe 10 minutes, which can take you to other places. There are lots of little restaurants, cafes and pizza shops nearby to eat at/from as well as a couple of supermarkets where you can buy food and drink to have in the apartment. Other things worth mentioning: -We had WiFi internet access available which we bought at 3 Euro for 24 hours. 24 hours in this case is actually 24 hours of use as long as you remember to log out of the system as opposed to 9am on one day to 9am the next. -There is a phone in the room which is connected to all the apartments, the Crosti Hotel rooms and the hotel reception in case you need to ask anything. -If you have no outstanding payments (eg WiFi) you can leave the key in your room and don't have to check out, or at least you could when we stayed. -Some people we travelled with stayed in the hotel at the same time. I had a look inside their room to compare it. I'd say the quality of finish was slightly better in the hotel although obviously there wasn't the living/kitchen area. The water in the fridge wasn't free, but breakfast was included and you have the reception/staff available at the bottom of the stairs. I'd happily stay in either the hotel or the apartments again. -We didn't see the staff that much because we were so busy, but whenever we did they were always polite and helpful. All in all, this was a superb stay and very reasonably priced. The quality and location of the apartment were outstanding for the price paid, and the staff were all very nice. I would definitely recommend the apartments to anyone, with the possible exception of people who can't stand a tiny lift/can't manage lots of steps because you'll need to negotiate at least one of them. Other than that I can't think of any reason I wouldn't recommend The Crosti Apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Christmastravellers
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Crosti Apartments, had a 1 bedroom and 2 bedroom apartment. Apartments were very spacious, full kitchen, top of the line cappachino machine (which worked wonderfully well)-coffee included, dishwasher, front load washing machine. Water pressure-ok. Very close to the metro and all the sights. Safe area, didn't mind walking around at night. Loved the space, kids loved the space (very important!), small market just down the street, restaurant (very good) right beside apartments. Everything all the reviews said. Once again, Trip Advisor has come through with flying colours!

Reviews.Title: “good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: stickyTex
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends had 2 apts at the Crosti in late Sept.for 3 nights and were so happy when we checked in. We rented 2 that had adjoining terraces on the 6th floor, the view wasnt all that great but the fact that we could sit out in the evening and enjoy the great weather we had was wonderful. The terraces provided plenty of room with tables and chairs, flowerboxes with fresh flowers. The apt I had was huge for 2 people, it had 2 bedrooms, a large bathroom, and pretty big living area, which itself included a TV and DVD with a large selection of movies. The area that the apt is at, is perfect for getting around the city, Termini is 4 blocks away, and the metro is just a block away. Theres a bank and grocery 2 blocks away and 2 internet outlets very close as well. And as far as food and beverage, multiple choices within 2 block area, and 2 just right outside the front door of the apt. building. Or of course you could prepare your own, you have a kitchen, fully stocked with china and utensils. I did a whole lot of research before our trip, and location and price was high priority to our booking, and i tell you that if you have multiple people or even a couple, this place is a steal during the off season, you'll get twice the amount of room and a terrace if you choose for the same amount you would pay for almost any other hotel in all of Rome central. Book directly thru Hotel website, cut out the middleman, the staff at the Hotel Crosti are friendly and professional, and will give a discount coupon to a nice local restaurant nearby. P.S. The Hotel Crosti and the Crosti Apts. are managed by the same people but are 2 different locations, only separated by maybe 4 blocks, dont get confused during booking. If in an apt. you'll eat your breakfast over at the hotel, which was nice. And not all of the rooms at the Crosti Apts have terraces, just the top floors, so also be specific when booking on your preference. The hotel staff answered all my emails quite promptly. stickyTex

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, good facilities, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TomSleaford
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in August and got the special rate of 100 euros per night for three in the apartment with Breakfast. As others have reported the lift is tiny and we were on the top floor, but there is a novelty value in this. The apartment has real facilities for cooking and washing and we ate in on most evenings with the advantage of a large balcony. There are a couple of supermarkets within easy reach and the metro is also close by. The additional bed is slightly cramped but my daughter was fine with this. The air con works and the shower room is clean and newly fitted. A nice touch was bottled water left in the fridge (indvididual 500ml bottles) by the cleaner ready for the next day. Yes, it is slightly niosy at night but you are in Rome. As other have commented the breakfast is good, order your cappocino as you enter and enjoy the variety of cakes. All in all, fantastic value and friendly staff. If you want to self cater and have your breakfast made for you - this is the place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Crosti!”
Reviews.Author: JRLCW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment at the Crosti during April 2010. Originally the trip was only going to be two of us (myself and 13 yo daughter), but at the last minute, some friends decided to join us (another 13 yo and her mom). Since the apartment we had booked slept four, they joined us at the Crosti. Well, we had a blast and the Crosti apartment was perfect for us. The bedroom had a kingsize bed and the living area a double pullout sofabed, kitchen, and dining table. With two always-hungry kids in tow, we made good use of the kitchen! We also had a very nice outside terrace area that was perfect for evening meals/snacks and just general relaxing. The apartment was very clean and even had a washer in the bathroom. As others have mentioned, the apartments are a short walk away from the hotel and breakfast, as well as convenient to the subway, buses, and train station. There are several markets, banks, restaurants, laundromats, etc. in the area as well. We loved the small market just down the street from the hotel -- we bought wonderful cheeses, prosciutto, bread, wines, and olives there several times during our stay. If you stand in front of the hotel, with your back to the main entrance to the hotel, walk down the street directly in front of you and the market is just a block or two on your left. Highly recommended! It was so nice to have an apartment to return to after long days of sightseeing and the Crosti apartments are within easy reach of all the major sites. We had booked online and paid 120 euro/night which included breakfast. Also would like to mention as 2 women traveling alone with two teen girls, we felt safe and secure in the neighborhood, even when returning late at night, usually walking back from the bus stops at the train station. Would also like to give a shout out to Rome by Segway on Via Ostilia (near the Colosseum). My daughter and I had taken a Segway tour in another city and she was dying to do it again. Both girls (and moms!) had a great time. Check it out. Hope to return to Rome and the Crosti again sometime soon!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Europeoz
Reviews.Content: Pluses. Apartment size is very good, with a seperate kitchen, lounge dinning, bedroom and bathroom. We chose to pay additional for a balcony which is worth it, although limited view. Breakfast is served in the hotel (about a 10 minute walk away and is good value. Apartment has a washing machine, which after 17 days on the road was a great advantage (no dryer). Negatives The apartment is in a building of various hotels apartments. The lift needs all doors closed when leaving or wont work (no sign saying this) so after a regular 6 flights of stairs to get to the apartment because the lift was unavailable I would not like to be ederly or have an injury. Such a simple thing as a multi laungage note would fix. Noise. Not external as its well sound proofed but internal from the stair wells and other apartments. Unit 16 has a "door"between it and apartment 18 that is only ply board thick and all conversations and particularly music could be heard from our neighbours and I assume from us. Very annoying and not much sleep. Bed. We have had some hard beds on this trip but this qualified as the worst as one side ok and the other as hard as a rock. Enough said

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: WalshFamilyIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Crosti apartments on Via Villa franka. Excellent rooms, with all conveniences. Fresh towels and even bottels water each day. Spacious rooms and a spacious terrace. Within 15 minutes walk from Rome Termini Station. Although the Castro Pretoria Metro station is only 3 minutes walk from the apartments. The hotel breakfast is great. Cereals, fruit, pasteries, tea, coffe, juice..................... Great breakfast to set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect retreat in the centre of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: akavanagh
Reviews.Content: Spacoius air-conditioned apartments in the centre of Rome close to the Termini rail station and other metro stations. Immaculate and spacious rooms, some with a nice terrace. Simple breakfast served at the nearby Hotel Crosti. Kind and considerate staff. The appartments are fully equiped with appliances and a small kitchenette. Many nearby, reasonable value, resteraunts. Very tranquil as the apartments are on the upper floors. Access may be an issue for wheelchair users as the elevator is quite narrow. We woulnd't hesitate to stay again or recommend this as a base to see this wonderful city of Rome. .

Reviews.Title: “nice apartment esp if travelling with a...”
Reviews.Author: mars4d
Reviews.Content: nice apartment esp if travelling with a family. Close enough to metro 1 block away to get to all major sites also walking distance from termini

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view from the patio"”
Reviews.Author: lynniepie
Reviews.Content: The Crosti has a hotel and then has apartments a few blocks away. That was fine with me although at first I wondered where the bellman was taking us. Up seven floors in the smallest elevator I have ever seen and into a little haven away from the hectic streets of Rome. We were so tired from the train ride when we got into Rome when I stepped out on the patio I was so glad to have a place to relax, and the weather was perfect too! The apartment suited the needs of my husband, son and I with a separate bedroom, kitchen area and living area. There is a grocery store, and I mean a big grocery, down about two blocks and you are a half- block from the metro. The building is safe and quiet. And it had a washing machine, no dryer but after being on the road six days that was a treat. A small drying rack on the patio, dried everything by the next afternoon, mind you our weather was perfect for 6 days in Rome!. I didn't think I booked with breakfast included but they said breakfast was and we did have our cappuccino and toast every morning but they had a full italian breakfast buffet. We bought our Roma pass right at the desk a must for the metro, bus, and skip the lines. And the internet was 3 euro for 24 hours usage, not a 24 hour day but a total usage of 24 hours which lasted my son the whole trip. Overall I loved the apartments and would definately do it again! My guys found this Ethiopian restaurant down about 3 blocks and they loved the Asmara, not me so much but hey I was in Rome! Hotel staff was very helpful and by day six my cappuccino gal almost had my decaf ready when I walked in!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: baalsoptio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Crosti apartments in Rome for 2 weeks over Christmas in 2009. We were in the 7th floor apartment, which was basically a large bathroom, a bedroom, and a kitchen/living room with a nice large terrace balcony. This apartment was conveniently located near the main Termini train station, making site seeing around Rome very easy. If you like walking, it is also quite easy to walk to all of the ancient Rome attractions. Only the Vatican is a considerable distance away, but the train can make it quick. The apartment was impeccably maintained during our stay. The continental breakfast was very good, with a nice variety of food and exceptional service. All staff were very friendly, spoke excellent English (compensating for my horrible Italian), and were willing to give advice on anything that I might ask. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. In its price range, I highly doubt that it could be topped in all of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money clean comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Womanathome
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 4 nights in two crosti apartments as a family. The best place to stay when you want to see Rome and enjoy the lovely breakfast at the Crosti hotel a couple of blocks away. The Apartments with the Kitchen and balconies was very handy. We also have discovered a lovely restaurant a block away La Tavernetta in Via Vicenza 56. The Restaurant was the best value and best food we ate in Italy. The friendly staff gave us lovely starters and wine for free as well. I higly recommend the Crosti Apartments and the restaurant around the corner. The lift was an experience providing some interesting video scenes for us. Watch out for the photo scammers at the Colleseum I will cost you if you let them take a photo with your camera. It cost me 25 euro. See my expensive scam photo.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Apartments, Great Location, Great Staff, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Berant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Crosti Hotel Apartments (Junior Suite Apartment) for 3 nights from the 11-14 Dec 2009. What a GREAT stay and what great value! We really, really enjoyed our vacation. Although the apartment is situated around the corner from the actual Crosti Hotel itself (they own the top 3 floors and the building's lift), we had a very spacious room on the 6th floor which had a large kitchenette/sitting room area, very large bathroom with an average sized shower, but which had hot water on demand, and there was a lovely large double bedroom (with a double bed, NOT 2 x single beds shoved together). The lift worked very well, but be warned, it literally only holds 2-3 people, maximum, and is quite narrow. We took the express train from the airport into the Termini Station in Rome and the apartments are just a 5-10 min easy walk away. There are at least 2 supermarkets in easy reach of the apartment, and a really wonderful cafe/restaurant across the road that did a fantastic lunch for around 7 euro a head....tea and cappucino's were 1euro each, and a glass of wine with our meal was only 2.50 euro. Our stay in the apartment included breakfast at the main Crosti Hotel each morning, which was a lovely contintental breakfast consisting of cold meats, hard boiled eggs, cereals, cheeses, breads, croissants, fruits, etc. and a selection of cakes to choose from. We walked almost everywhere, it took about 25 mins or so to get to the Colleseum, and/or spanish steps, etc. but taxis were cheap...so when we got tired we just hopped in a taxi and it usually only cost around 4-7 euro...the most expensive taxi we took was from the Vatican back to the apartment which was around 12 euro. The Hotel is only open a few years, but they also own a family-run restaurant called "Da Vincenzo's" which they have run for 40 years, and is very large, beautifully decorated, full of atmosphere and was full of italian locals (always a great sign!)...and we had a great night there.....it is what I would consider to be mid-priced and we paid around 93 euro + tip for a 3 course meal, nice bottle of wine and coffees... We would highly recommend this restaurant, even if you are not staying at the Crosti! Da Vincenzo's is closed on Sunday nights and the Concierge recommended a nearby restaurant, which was absolutely gorgeous as well, however it only seats around 40 people, so unless you are eating out early, you would need to make a reservation. Everywhere was spotlessly clean, with our apartments being cleaned daily, with fresh towels etc. every day. We had such a great time during our stay in Rome and would definitely stay here again. If you want a really excellent base, in a nice, safe, clean, central location, then the Hotel Crosti and its apartments are a great choice.
